description:
Our next meetup will be in June. It's another virtual meetup with two great speakers. Join us on zoom at 7pm. You'll get the link when you RSVP.

Just started learning Ruby? Thinking about starting to learn? Been writing Ruby for years? Please join us, and feel free to invite anyone who might be interested, because remember: Ruby really is awesome (https://blog.teamtreehouse.com/why-ruby-is-awesome).

== Nicolas Alpi, CookiesHQ ==

"4 years ago CookiesHQ built GoodSixty as an MVP marketplace where users can buy local food from local retailers. Over the past 4 years, the platform grew at a steady pace, but, as with every startup product, some corners had to be cut because of budget and time. It wasn’t a big deal, we would always have the time to look at them after the next raise.

But, Covid-19 happened, and, overnight GoodSixty app traffic increased by almost 3000%. Conversion rate followed the same path. And, for the past 9 weeks, those two metrics haven’t really declined.

I would like to share what we’ve learned so far about how to manage such a rapid increase, what unexpected corners cut came to bite us in the arse, the good surprises, and everything we’ve learned about supporting your clients in times like this."

== Christian Bruckmayer, Cookpad ==

Building a Performance Analytics Tool with ActiveSupport

"Setting up a performance analytics tool like NewRelic or Skylight is one of the first things many developers do in a new project. However, have you ever wondered how these tools work under the hood?

In this talk, we will build a basic performance analytics tool from scratch. We will deep dive into ActiveSupport instrumentations to collect, group and normalise metrics from your app. To persist these metrics, we will use a time series database and visualise the data on a dashboard. By the end of the talk, you will know how your favourite performance analytics tool works."

* * *

Schedule

Join Zoom at 7pm. You'll get the link when you RSVP.

7.05pm - Nic Alpi
7.30pm - Break
7.40pm - Christian Bruckmayer

* * *

Slack

If you have any questions or suggestions please join us on Slack. Go to https://bathruby-for-slackers.herokuapp.com and find us in the #south-west-ruby channel

* * *

Look forward to seeing you soon!
title: South West Ruby #27 (ONLINE)
